newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo Motor's Bupyong plant workers plan strike.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo Motor's Bupyong plant workers plan strike.

text.p: The union at South Korea's Daewoo Motor Co said its members would stage a one-day strike on Wednesday at the company's Bupyong plant.
"As wage negotiations broke down today, we will go on strike tomorrow," Daewoo Motor's union leader Kim Jong-jin said on Tuesday. "Further action will depend on the management's attitude."

The union, which has 10,171 members at Bupyong, just west of Seoul, calls for a 9.7 percent rise in basic salary payments for this year, while the management is offering a 5.45 percent increase, union officials said.
Company officials said they expected moderate union members to keep production lines running.
